qas.question: CBC was eclusive carrier of what other sport during the 2004-2005 season?
What is CBC Country Canada now called?
Who became the new exclusive carrier of curling broadcasts during the 2008-2009 season?
On what day was it announced CBC had lost exclusve rights to curling broadcasting?
What popular Canadian sport event overtook hockey viewership in 2004-2005?

plausible_answers.text: CBC Country Canada (now called Cottage Life Television

qas.question: The CBC created which network in hopes of retaining their contract with the curling association?
After numerous court battles, the CBC agreed to transfer exclusive rights to curling events to what broadcast station?
The 2008-2009 curling championship games led to the highest ratings in how many years?

context: It was also the exclusive carrier of <b4_0>Canadian <a0_0>Curling<a0_0/> Association events<b4_0/> during the 2004–2005 season. Due to disappointing results and fan outrage over many draws being carried on <b5_0>CBC Country Canada (now called <a1_0>Cottage Life Television<b5_0/><a1_0/>, the association tried to cancel its multiyear deal with the CBC signed in 2004. After the CBC threatened legal action, both sides eventually came to an agreement under which early-round rights reverted to <a2_0>TSN<a2_0/>. On <a3_0>June 15, 2006<a3_0/>, the CCA announced that <b6_0>TSN<b6_0/> would obtain exclusive rights to curling broadcasts in Canada as of the 2008-09 season, shutting the CBC out of the championship weekend for the first time in <b7_0>40-plus years<b7_0/>.
